abstract: Methodist University Hospital has Steve Jobs’s permission to speak, and it says his prognosis is excellent.
snippet: Methodist University Hospital has Steve Jobs’s permission to speak, and it says his prognosis is excellent.
lead_paragraph: Methodist University Hospital in Memphis acknowledged Tuesday that it had performed a liver transplant on Steven P. Jobs, the chief executive of Apple.

headline.main: Memphis Hospital Says It Did Jobs’s Liver Surgery
headline.print_headline: Hospital in Memphis Says It Did Jobs’s Liver Surgery

abstract: Apple’s board needs to put out a straightforward, unambiguous statement about the health of Steven P. Jobs.
snippet: Apple’s board needs to put out a straightforward, unambiguous statement about the health of Steven P. Jobs.
lead_paragraph: The columnist Joe Nocera shared his analysis of Apple’s secrecy on his blog, Executive Suite.

headline.main: Steve Jobs and Apple: Here We Go Again

abstract: A columnist argues that Apple C.E.O. Steve Jobs would draw more attention to the fight against pancreatic cancer if he chose to speak about his health.
snippet: A columnist argues that Apple C.E.O. Steve Jobs would draw more attention to the fight against pancreatic cancer if he chose to speak about his health.
lead_paragraph: Tara Parker-Pope, health columnist and author of The Well blog at The Times, offers her perspective on disclosures about the health of Apple’s chief executive, Steve Jobs:

headline.main: Why Steve Jobs Should Talk About His Health
